website_summaries.verdict: People are generally with the New Balance 880 v10 and what it has to offer. This road running shoe has a comfortable midsole configuration, a versatile build that can handle multiple activities, and a form-welcoming nature that can better the performance. Inversely, a restrictive foot-wrap and a not-so-durable forefoot section embody the negative side.Fans of New Balance can check out the 880 v10, an update that focuses on comfort.
pros: The underfoot cushioning system of the New Balance 880 v10 is lauded for being able to support the foot throughout the run
Some consumers who complain about sensitive knees and leg muscles are happy with the impact-mitigation given by the underfoot platform
Custom orthotic inserts can acclimate well inside the foot-chamber, according to some runners
Most users have commented that this New Balance running shoe is comfortable right out of the box
The stretchy upper is welcomed for accommodating the foot’s range of motion and natural swelling capacity
‘Versatile’ is a term that several purchasers have used to describe this running shoe as they’re walking or using it for work
cons: Some users have claimed that the eyestays have a tendency to crinkle the tongue and restrict the in-shoe environment
A few people observe the toes scratching against the ceiling of the inner fabrics, causing some material damage
The hug of the upper unit is considered restrictive by a handful of purchasers

customer_reviews.title: Great cushion, long lasting
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of New Balance 880 running shoes that I've purchased. I run five days per week, and at 45 years old my knees require a shoe with some good quality cushioning. I've tried Nike and Asics, but neither brand lasts as long as New Balance. I get 2-3 months more wear out of New Balance shoes. I replaced my Nike and Asics shoes every six months because my knees began to hurt (the cushioning was worn out); I've been getting 8-9 months wear from the New Balance 880s.
customer_reviews.author: Green Machine

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, Your body will thank you
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a casual runner.. Once or maybe twice a week- couple miles. However, I stand for 8 hours a day sometimes, and these are the best shoes I've ever felt on my feet. I have big arches, wide feet, plantar fasciitis, ingrown toenails, and a bad back (I'm only 32!) , and these are like walking on clouds. They provide the softest cushion, yet they are incredibly stable and firm. Every aspect of this shoe is great and my body thanks me. I wasn't excited about spending $130 on a shoe that looks like every other $50 pair of New Balances, but the are worth every penny. Get them and thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: JoeP

customer_reviews.title: This is the just right choice of the "3 bears".
customer_reviews.text: Perfect split between the 860 and the 1080: Not too hard/ stiff and not too soft. Good all-around running shoes with a medium hight heal, modest support and just enough cushion. I did buy both the current 860 and 1080 so this is an honest comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel L. Robinson II

customer_reviews.title: Fit fine, tongue is poorly made
customer_reviews.text: The material and durability of this show is good but the fit is a little awkward on the outer edge of the arch. This is good because it helps to my asked inward instead of outward, so it's good when running but feels awkward when standing. I don't like wearing these shoes for the simple fact that the tongue constantly slips away from the top of the foot and rotates to the outer edge of the shoe despite trying different lacing methods. The tongue bunches up to the outside of my foot instead of staging on top within minutes or a fewsteps after readjusting them. I don't recommend this shoe based on that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Lit RoxTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Way too narrow and way too big
customer_reviews.text: I'm very surprised. I bought these to replace an identical pair I bought about a year ago. I bought the same size and width, and while the labels reflected the correct size, the pair I got were narrow, and way too big. The label reads 11.5, and these are easily 12.5, maybe even larger. That runs my streak of bad online shoe purchases to six pairs in a row. I've yet to buy a pair that fits as expected. Normally, I'd just go to the store, but this time, I thought I'd avoid the mask nazis, and COVID rigmarole. I was wrong. It's too bad, they seem like nice shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Flakne

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes ever. I have third-degree flat feet and always had trouble finding a good shoe that would accommodate my orthotics new balance is the only shoe that fits my orthotics perfectly and these 880 version 10 fresh foam is the best ever they are so comfortable it’s almost like walking on air I just love em. I just ordered another pair in blue. I highly recommend these
customer_reviews.author: Yosefaaron

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, comfort, and performance. Could absorb even more shock.
customer_reviews.text: These are a night-and-day difference over my old cross-trainers. I can run every day without foot pain. They're also light and breathable. Traction could be better, but they're just running shoes. Given the hype around Fresh Foam, I was hoping for even more shock absorption, but I'd still recommend them as a great bang-for-buck option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for neutral feet!
customer_reviews.text: Great for someone with a neutral foot. If you are not sure have a running store fit you. They ran on the large side so we had to keep trying several sizes but my boyfriend likes a tighter shoe. Get the size you usually get and go from there. You want a little space at the toe of the shoes as your feet do swell after working out/walking and will enlarge a bit. We got these as training shoes for proper stability at the foot ankle complex. You don’t want Payless shoes as training shoes. It must fit your foot type: whether pronator, supinator or neutral foot. :)
customer_reviews.author: Marta B.

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I’m about 6 months into a running program, somewhat new to running as I used to hate it but needed to add in the cardio to my fitness regimen. Having gone thru 4 pairs of running shoes from Nike to UA to ASICS I have found the perfect running shoes with these New Balance 880’s!!! Everything is excellent, cushion, energy return, stability, lightweight, looks these are the total package! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe, need aftermarket insert
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoe, like that it’s all black which blends in well with work attire. I wear this at work. However I had to purchase a $40 aftermarket insert, because the insert that comes with the shoe is completely flat and very thin. One of the cheaper ones I’ve seen.
customer_reviews.author: Mud Flap Girls Fan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: As with all New Balance shoes, these are very comfortable, durable, and good looking. My only concern is that they are a bit more narrow than the previous version, which decreases the comfort somewhat. Mine are size 12 Xtra-wide.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cushioning
customer_reviews.text: I like this shoe a lot. It’s not easy to find a shoe like this in extra wide. I should probably buy a second pair. Update 8/12/20. I bought a second pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Ace Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and well made.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are a replacement for the NB 880V8 that I have wore out. A little nervous buying shoes on line, but with the free return policy I thought why not. The 880V10 are as good fitting and comfortable as the V8 model that I currently own. I found the size and width to be accurate.
customer_reviews.author: david gambini

customer_reviews.title: Wear. Run. Repeat.
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable running shoes I’ve ever owned. I’m a very flat foot runner and these shoes give the perfect cushion and arch support to keep me going for miles.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Harris

customer_reviews.title: not bad but not good
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is comfy but I would return if I could. The shoe gave me lower back pain while running and shin splints. I believe it may be because the heel of the shoe is thicker than I am use to but I am not sure. I don't run in these anymore. I ran about 15 miles in these shoes before I gave up on them. Still comfy enough to wear to the gym though.
customer_reviews.author: Quinton

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable. Fits perfectly and as expected when compared to all other NB shoes. Would buy again with no questions.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D. Church

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Fit great and are very comfortable. I will be getting another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip C.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband and he loves it. I’m glad I go this for him.
customer_reviews.author: rycelonia a tan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Awesome running show providing excellent support and stability. I do recommend Spenco inserts to replace the manufacturer inserts - just provides support and minimizes impact a lot when running!
customer_reviews.author: DHill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable running shoes. I have other NB models and this one is far better. I recommend these shoes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tad to tight
customer_reviews.text: The wide runs just a bit to tight compared to my other new balance shoes
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: High rating by an older runner
customer_reviews.text: I've been running regularly for over fifty years, and this is the best shoe I have ever owned. Great stability and near-perfect cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I gave these to my son for his birthday and he says they are very comfortable. He would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Greer

customer_reviews.title: New balance
customer_reviews.text: With constant foot problems I always go New Balance and deliver as expected
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Shoes
customer_reviews.text: The foam is weird at first. But after few runs it get are nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good shoes, comfortable, but not well-suited for forefoot strike
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are excellent: comfortable, provide a lot of support and cushioning (but not too much). I've already put quite a few miles on them. The one thing I did notice is that they do not collaborate very well with a pronounced forefoot strike running style. It has a good amount of cushioning in the heel, but can get a little uncomfortable if you tend to forefoot strike, especially on longer runs. In my case I felt like the front part of the sole had grooves or ridges (perhaps the distribution of foam) that started to make painful impressions. Just something to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Johan Bollen

customer_reviews.title: Quality shoe for all terrain
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and these fit extremely comfortably and provide support in all terrain. I am really pleased with this brand and the shoe as I tend to be pretty picky and find most shoes uncomfortable. I put about 40+ miles per week on them varying from trail, gravel, and road - all without any issues with my shoes. A bit pricey but worth every penny for those medium to hard core runners.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my old NB shoes which were worn to the sole. After some looking around I found these to be a good "middle of the road" shoe for a good price. It may not be the top of the line for NB but if you need a good shoe for normal jogging to stay in shape this is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Hyer

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from previous version of 880
customer_reviews.text: This new version definitely feels better than my prior 880's...more stability and comfort. I also think that they are aesthetically more attractive for what it's worth...not much in a shoe I only use for running!
customer_reviews.author: RLW10

customer_reviews.title: Fit
customer_reviews.text: I have wide ft with a high instep. So only the EW New Balance of certain models work. The 840, 940, 1080 & 1260 have work well for me. I tried the 880 and feel it’s a very good fit for me. Will be getting more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Cally

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit and Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for people with wider feet! And the cushioning is superior to the Brooks and Mizuno shoes I have.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoes ..a lot of spring to them... I'm a big heavy guy and they work great
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sonofthehoundofulster

customer_reviews.title: Quality running shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of 880s that I bought for running. I also have a pair of 860s. Previous 880s were version 9 and I wore the sole out. The pair I just bought are version 10. New Balance seems to continuously improve the shoe which is why I only buy NB now.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: Shoes wear very quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they had good reviews but I found they break down very quickly. They wore to the outside a lot quicker than any other shoe I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Louie Marquez

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: needed some give - not leather - in toe box and this is perfect
customer_reviews.author: off

customer_reviews.title: There is a hole in the toe after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This are the first NB i have bought after reading lots of reviews, they fit very well and seem comfortable but after a couple of months of use, started feeling my big toe poke out and now there are two holes.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Frazelle

customer_reviews.title: Two pairs with failed heel
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of these shoes within two months (I let the return time expire a day too late on the first pair). These were for my son at a military academy and the heel failed on the first pair. I sent a second pair and the exact same thing happened. Sadly, I am a New Balance devotee and these are the first shoes that have literally disappointed me. Now, I may not meet the return deadline as my son has to find time to mail them back to me within the time. One pair failure, I understand. Two pairs fail with the exact thing, something is wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Niles nation

customer_reviews.title: Big guys who run high miles!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fat guy at 5'10 240 pounds but I run around 30 to 40 miles a week. I love these 880s fresh foams! No pain in my knees and I can run 5 to 6 times s week!
customer_reviews.author: Sean c

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's M880B10 Running Shoe, Blue, 6.5 UK
